Ocoee () is a city in Orange County: Ocoee was incorporated in 1922 (or 1923) and became a city in 1925.Highway construction was the impetus for Ocoee's growth in the 20th century. State Road 50 (SR 50) was constructed south of downtown Ocoee in 1959 and provided a direct east-west connection between the City and a growing Orlando. The development of what would become Florida State Road 50 made the town more accessible to housing developers.  Florida's Turnpike was opened just south of downtown Ocoee in 1964.  In late 1990
Florida: Ocoee was connected to Orlando by a western extension of Florida State Road 408 (the East-West Expressway) which then joined the Florida's Turnpike south of SR 50.  In 2000
United States. As of the 2010 census: the completion of Florida State Road 429 (the Western Expressway) linked Ocoee with Walt Disney World to the south.
